result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd A Dittberner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF304, 15CF171, 14CF561, and 14CF220. Court agreed.  Transcript will be ordered.  Court will reschedule this matter.  Notices will be sent by JA.  11:08/11:16

2:35 p.m. Cases called: 14CF220, 14CF304, 14CF561, 15CF171 & 15CF419, Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by victim and defendant's father. Sentencing statements by ADA Genda and Atty. Martinez. Court noted not enough time to finish today and continued sentencing to future date. Court told Defendant to be prepared to start serving sentence immediately. 15CF419 read in and dismissed. Court adjourned 3:30 p.m.

Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF171, 15CF69, 14CF220, 14CF304, 14CF561, & 13CM530.   In 15CF171 $2500.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  No contact with A.H. or her residence.  Contact through a third party for child is ok only after birth of child.  In 14CF220 preliminary hearing was already waived.  In 15CF171, 15CF69, 14CF561, & 14CF304 Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  Separate sentencing date will be set by Atty Martinez. 13CM530 Defendant stood mute.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Matter will be set for trial.
